title: A tower went down in bot lane. Looks like both of the mid champs are done farming
body:
Cause we're gonna group as 4 in mid and just stay there indefinitely, clearing waves by missing cs cause we spam skills til we're oom and someone takes drag.

Team pls

Edit: It's fine if you come to defend from a siege before dragon. But remember to not kill minions like you're the only one who needs items. Cause that makes the mid laner abandon mid and go to your lane you left to stay relevant in levels and gold. 

Since you clearly couldn't.

replies.body: Oh god I love when our bot lane wins or loses a tower then decides to come mid and "help" me by taking my CS and XP.

As a support main, I ask: What do you want us to do?

We can't stay bot because we would be open to ganks. When we go mid, we will try to take the tower down to gain map control and have easier access to dragon. Yeah, it sucks that ADCs will usually take all the farm from the mid, but that's the fastest way to push.

Continue pushing and use wards. Hold the lane so you keep farming but the lane isn't pushing as crazy. You staying down there keeps bot down there. And if the jungler is trying to gank he is kept down there too giving us more map pressure.

Nonsence. If we are pushing without a tower, it will take 5 wards to cover us. I can't lay 5 wards, and they expire. A common reason I need to be is that ai am OOW. You are not making sense, you are complaining about bot loosing lane.

I do not care to be permaganked, and not every support has the CC to escape a gank, like Karma, soraka, sona, Leona (not mobile), malphite.... Need I go on?

this jsut dont work

Yep if your team is good they can earn advantage from jungler, adc and supp being in bottom lane.
And if so thats good.

But that is mostly not the case.
Therfore it is safer and better for whole team just to push midlane and force something.
It doesn't matter if your team is good if they are still pushing in lane they are going to benefit from not having another person barge into the lane. Go help your jungler take dragon or something.

It does matter, Your midlaner will play psssively, your jungler will just farm in his jungle and toplaner will just farm.
That is not enough.

If this situation is to be advanteous, your jungler will have to gang somewhere or counterjungle or go kill that damn dragon.
Your midlaner will have to sieze the opportunity and get the kill or the tower with help of jungler or top laner.
In other words, the team would have to work togheter.

Just pushing is too much to ask from your teammates in soloQ.
And even so, "just pushing" is still not enough if enemy ADC gets triple and several waves advantage.

> If this situation is to be advanteous, your jungler will have to gang somewhere or counterjungle or go kill that damn dragon.

Wrong. Pushing your lane and gaining more pressure and control of the map, along with more CS and XP is going to be advantageous.

Your jungler is most likely going to do 1 of 3 of those, If he isn't getting dragon but you guys can easily secure it then go to the dragon and ping. If he needs farm then let him farm, all the laners rape his jungle mid/late game anyway.

> Your midlaner will have to sieze the opportunity and get the kill or the tower with help of jungler or top laner.

Right. So leave them alone while they do that. The problem mid laners have is when the support and ADC come into lane and start taking farm and XP. Then they push the wave to the tower and the enemy mid laner defends it no problem. You are wasting everyones time. And only weakening your own midlaner. 

Obviously come later into the mid game everyone is wandering and such but it is when the bot lane wins lane and instead of pushing there victory they decide to go mid and weaken the mid laner.

> Just pushing is too much to ask from your teammates in soloQ.
And even so, "just pushing" is still not enough if enemy ADC gets triple and several waves advantage.

Oh. Your whole scenario that you're giving me is basically, But what if my entire team is a bunch of monkeys? If you are in a team where every single person is dead set on farming and pushing lanes you weren't going to win anyway.

Now in a normal game where people aren't as braindead as you say. The 2 top laners will stay top until one of them has a tower. 

Mid lane will usually keep priority on keeping their own tower and wander down river for a kill or helping in any way such as at the dragon or to help bot lane if they lose their own tower.

Jungler will either be ganking, farming, or securing dragon.

Now again, If you win your bot tower, and roaming hasn't started ward up and keep going. Do not go mid and pretend you are helping anyone but yourself by taking the CS from the mid laner, it is hard enough as it is to get CS during the lane phase we don't need you to take it from us. And keep the enemy pushed to their tower when you could be keeping pressure bot lane.  

Eventually someone somewhere in top or mid is going to leave to deal with bot lane, in which case the proper reaction for the team is to take the tower.

But you might ask what happens if you get stomped bot lane? Don't go to the friggin mid lane. Farm under tower, As an ADC you should be trying to make yourself not be useless. Going mid is just going to put your mid laner at a loss because now they are falling behind in XP and CS because of greed.

Yeah, as a support main I often go "support" mid, if it's losing or fairly even, or cover it while mid goes top, but adc's tend to just farm, and it really doesn't help. Most Mid laners have a mini nuke wave clear skill. as support i'd weaken a bunch of the higher hp minions to give the Mid a wave clear, but the adc will just steal half of them :P

Also, @Domain, do you ever play tank supports, get face of the mountain, and find that no one, in any lane, ever lets you last hit a minion? I have been in situations where the adc or mid laner has almost no hp, but doesn't want to back off, so I try heal them a bit but they refuse to share lol. They often apologise after, but if they don't stop doing it, the apology feels a bit Hollow :/ (was very happy when I was defending top, Ryze came to wave clear, then left the big minion for my last FotM stack :D) too few players like this

Relic Shield and Targon's Brace execute under 200 and 240 health, respectively.  So unless you are playing Thresh, I have no sympathy for you.  Early game, if you miss opportunities to get the last hit with that execute, it's your own fault.

If you are later in the game and have Face of the Mountain, you mostly have that for the shield it provides, not the gold generation.  Every other item is better for gold generation once you reach the point where you should mostly be roaming to ward and your team WANTS to just shove the waves and move elsewhere.  Expecting people to sit still so you can last hit at that point is a bit ridiculous.

How ignorant is that, Thresh has the easier time with relic shield, not the hardest, because in order to get that execute you need to get in range, which often your opponent sees you trying to do and will poke you out. You should only go to the canon minions with early forms of relic shield, and you shouldn't sit next to it waiting for the hp to get lower. So when the adc gets it down to about 50% and you move in, then they use a skill to burst it, then wtf are you meant to do, you have no sympathy cause you clearly haven't been in that situation. It's not hard to last hit, but your adc can prevent you from doing so if they want to (non canon minions is different because there's usually one you can just hit quickly, but you waste a stack of the item for when the canon ones arrive)

To be clear, you can use the first two stacks on anything, and get you next one back by the time the first canon minion arrives, but after that you should save them where possible, hence it being difficult when your adc goes out of their way to secure minions, you were gonna share with them anyway

Late game is different. First of all, I am talking mostly about situations where you've frozen a wave in front of a turret and are not pushing but waiting for allies who are farming jungle or still in base, you have all the time in the world to give your tank support some extra gold. Yes the item is not as effecient as others, doesn't mean you should make it harder.

And as for last hitting, you attack animation is much slower than an adc's so what i am talking about is a wave of minions, all with low hp because of a skill just used. You want to hit 1, 4 if you're lucky, but your adc specifically targets the one your aiming for. They can kill any of them, but they aim at your one out of instinct (cause they don't want you to steal it) so you aim at the next one, and the next one, but you get 0 because they attack faster than you, even though you would wave clear faster if you split your focus and hit different ones, so it's not about push speed, it's about selfish habbits of adc's that have been playing before the introduction of FoTM or play often with mage supports and forget that your not stealing but sharing. 

I have actually saved charges of targons embrace for team fights and engages, because a well timed heal when the enemy flashes out of your melee range can give your adc that extra bit they need to win. I've saved lives with triple heal by killing minions (now I just play taric, it's easier) so timing and application of the item are important, but are hard if your adc isn't willing to work for you, they ALWAYS have the farming advantage, so it's not your own fault if they block you out

Thresh's AA is counted as ranged and therefore does not proc the execute feature on the Relic Shield items, only the gold sharing function, so he has a harder time last hitting charges than say Leona or Taric.

That being said, I agree with the rest of your post.
Oh, I don't play thresh, I just see him in action, fair enough, I post on these pages to learn anyway :D

If the tower is going to fall shortly, by all means bot should come and help, but if Mid is someone who is clearing the wave and preventing most, if not all damage, to the tower and herself, then bot lane should be trying to grab a tower.

Then there's the inbetween where the support does what you said.

You have to understand though (speaking as a support) as soon as the support leaves, bot adc will get ganked by like 3 guys, then rage rest of game about it. I understand, I've been a support player for years now. Eventually I just gave up somewhere and decided once bot lanes tower is down, if there's someone more deserving of what I can do that's where I'll be.

Allow me to reword the OP's point in a way which makes more sense:
When bot lane takes the opponent's tower, their emphasis (and that of most junglers) switches from farming/ganking to objectives.  The most pressing of these objectives is dragon.  Taking bot tower opens up dragon to be taken by your team.  If you are currently not in a position to take dragon, the 2nd most pressing objective is mid tower.  By going mid and taking their tower, you further open up dragon.

This doesn't mean that mid's emphasis goes from farming to objectives.  Instead, what you tend to have is a mid who is still in the laning phase while you have a support, ADC, and jungler who have moved on to the objectives and forcing favorable team fights (mid game) phase.  If there is an opportunity to take mid tower, you absolutely should.  But having 3 or 4 mid and NOT taking mid tower is an absolute waste of time and resources.

So if you take bot turret, you should look at drag.  If drag isn't available, look to take mid turret.  If you can't do that, then stay bot and farm as the opposing team SHOULD be pushing the lane back towards you.

Honestly, I don't know why either of you would get upvotes. This whole thread is a huge lack of insight on how the game is played. You all think you're "learning up" bot lanes by telling them not to come mid and steal your farm. News flash, just because you want to 1v1 solo farm your lane longer, doesn't mean that's how the game should be played. There's 4 other people in the game. It's not black and white, there's no clear cut objectives. So many things can occur after a bot tower goes down.

And no one has been able to argue with the point I made about the opposite. There's been countless threads started where a mid laner complains that "after bot lane lost their tower, the enemy bot lane came mid, and my bot lane kept pushing, then I died 1v3 or 4 and lost my turret, then they got dragon, then they killed bot lane. HOW COME STOOPED BOT LANE NO HELP ME MID?"

Just because a bot lane comes mid, and nothing happens, doesn't mean it was a bad move. So you lost your solo xp and 2 waves of farm. I cannot tell you how many times I've pushed bot in that situation, thinking mid would be ok on tower clearing the waves and sitting back while the enemy wasted their time, only to watch him get hooked/pulled/charmed and killed. Then we're in a really bad spot pushing bot. 

Not to mention with Teleport meta, warding deep jungle doesn't guarantee safety. There's just countless instances that going mid is right and wrong, and staying bot is right  and wrong. This whole argument is illogical unless we're talking about ADCs sitting mid **last hitting**, purposefully stealing your farm, which is completely different.

I think you're being almost as single minded here. They've said several times, it's not "NEVER" come mid, it's let him farm or don't linger. In most cases, the support should roam and the adc push. A stalemate mid doesn't help anyone, but it typically takes one less to defend then to attack. If support and mid defend, they can stop 4 champs from pushing depending on the match up, and if they lose sight of one or two of the champs, they ss and bot should immediately back up to safety. Most problems arise when bot come mid to help (especially because enemy bot went mid), but then bot STAYS mid after the enemy have backed off, and then lose bot turret because they had to go base while the fresh bot laners pushed.
The other case is bot pushes too hard and gets ganked. it all comes to adaptability. The OP isn't wrong, in some ways neither are you, its not clear cut, but there are times where you don't sit mid, and there's times when you don't this post is getting upvoted by some, because they see his point, because he does clearly say, dont "not come mid" but let him farm or don't stay there indefinitely.

I posted before, as support, typically you go mid, with your cc you can defend if the others come, and your mechanics means you don't lose out but not farming, and the adc can push. If enemy goes bot, don't chase, push and secure mid. If adc can't escape, they get one kill, you get a turret. And jungler can come so you can still protect drake. But if you chase the adc who got TP ganked, chances are you will die one by one, not get mid turret or drake. If all 4 (excluding top) go mid. Jungler should help defend while adc stays bot to secure an objective. Unless mid engages (for some reason) they should be able to hold the turret, or worst case, lose in outer turret for an inner turret.

ADC's coming mid (outside of fast pushing - like after a big team fight) usually come for the kills, not to help. Mid and suppot can defend fine, but adc doesn't come for defence, but usually free farm and hopefully a tf = kill. But it often results in stalemate, for same reason, 2 can defend, and the enemy adc which was losing, now gets free farm bot...

The biggest problem with most players in these and many other scenarios is adaptability and stubbornness. They KNOW how to play, so they don't need to listen to others, the meta says drop bot tower, go drake, secure mid tower, etc, they don't change their game plan for the different game flows, and these discussions often go the same way.
